title: Soft Landing
medium: Graphite and pastel on cotton rag
alt: Graphite figure dissolving into blush pigment with a hand covering the mouth.
statement: A breath held between impulse and restraint, captured in graphite gradations and a single bruise of pink.

title: Tether
medium: Graphite, pastel, and conte on Lennox paper
alt: Graphite drawing of a mouth pulling a dark strand from a clenched hand with a crimson wash.
statement: Investigating hunger and boundaries through a single tension line drawn between a mouth and fist.

title: Chromatic Reliquary
alt: Iridescent blue face rendered over a blush ground with reflective highlights and lashes.
statement: A reflective shell capturing queer futurity—mirror-sheen contours soften into candy-colored drips.

title: Sugar Spell
alt: Portrait of a woman beneath a suspended spoon holding neon cereal in her mouth against a blush field.
statement: Balancing indulgence and vulnerability via saturated candy hues hovering over a quiet figure.

title: Mouth Variations I–VI
alt: Studio wall with six pink studies of open mouths pinned in a grid.
statement: A chorus of quiet screams, each contour line shifting the emotional register of the series.

title: Better? Worse? Same?
alt: Painting of a blue sky eye chart reading ‘Better? Worse? The Same?’ above a yellow field.
statement: Language tests perception: a pastoral horizon doubles as an optometrist’s chart probing certainty.

title: Signal Study
alt: Pink panorama featuring a graphite hare facing a slender tuning instrument.
statement: A long-form drawing staging animal vigilance against a razor-thin instrument of measurement.

title: I'm Sorry (Candy Hearts)
alt: Drawing of conversation hearts on a pink background, each stamped with the words ‘I’M SORRY’.
statement: Sweetness with an apology on repeat—anxious affection coated in confectionery gloss.
